Class SortingBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • SortingBuffer

  • public class SortingBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    The idea of this class is to get a value from each thread, and have each thread wait until its value becomes the minimum.
    Author:
    Tom Bylander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SortingBuffer(int numberOfThreads)
      Initialize numberOfThreads and current values for each thread.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finished(int thread)
      Indicates that the the thread is done with this object.
      void waitUntilMinimum(int thread, int value)
      Store the value from this thread.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • SortingBuffer

        public SortingBuffer(int numberOfThreads)
        Initialize numberOfThreads and current values for each thread.
        Parameters:
        numberOfThreads -

    • Method Detail

      • waitUntilMinimum

        public void waitUntilMinimum(int thread,
                    int value)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Store the value from this thread. Wait until the value is the minimum from all the threads. Return when the value becomes the minimum.

        It's not a very efficient way to compute the minimum, but it is straightforward.

        Parameters:
        thread -
        value -
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • finished

        public void finished(int thread)
        Indicates that the the thread is done with this object.
        Parameters:
        thread -
